required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Pharmacokinetic Profiles of Two Nicotine Gum Formulations
clinical_study.official_title: A Pharmacokinetic Study Comparing Two Nicotine Gum Formulations in a Single Dose Design

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to compare pharmacokinetic (PK) profiles and assess the bioequivalence between the newly developed nicotine gums (2 mg and 4 mg) and the reference nicotine gums (2 mg and 4 mg) in healthy smokers.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time 0 to Time 't' [AUC(0-t)] of Nicotine 2 mg Test and Reference Product
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples to be collected from baseline to 12 hours post dose
primary_outcome.description: AUC(0-t) for 2 mg test was compared with 2 mg reference gum

primary_outcome.measure: AUC(0-t) of Nicotine 4 mg Test and Reference Product
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples to be collected from baseline to 12 hours post dose
primary_outcome.description: AUC(0-t) of Nicotine 4 mg test was compared with 4 mg reference gum

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Concentration (Cmax) of Nicotine 2 mg Test and Reference Product
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples to be collected from baseline to 12 hours post dose
primary_outcome.description: Cmax for 2 mg test was compared with 2 mg reference gum

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax of Nicotine 4 mg Test and Reference Product
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples to be collected from baseline to 12 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Cmax for 4 mg test was compared with 4 mg reference gum

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Observed Concentration (Tmax) of Nicotine 2 mg Test and Reference Products, and Nicotine 4 mg Test and Reference Products
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples to be collected from baseline to 12 hours post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax for 2 mg test was compared with 2 mg reference gum, and 4 mg test was compared with 4 mg reference gum

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Terminal Elimination Half-life (T1/2) of Nicotine 2 mg Test and Reference Products, and Nicotine 4 mg Test and Reference Products
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples to be collected from baseline to 12 hours post dose
secondary_outcome.description: T1/2 of 2 mg test was compared with 2 mg reference gum, and 4 mg test was compared with 4 mg reference gum

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Terminal Elimination Rate Constant (Kel) of Nicotine 2 mg Test and Reference Products, and Nicotine 4 mg Test and Reference Products
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples to be collected from baseline to 12 hours post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Kel for 2 mg test was compared with 2 mg reference gum, and 4 mg test was compared with 4 mg reference gum

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 Extrapolated to ∞ [AUC(0-∞)] of Nicotine 2 mg Test and Reference Products, and Nicotine 4 mg Test and Reference Products
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples to be collected from baseline to 12 hours post dose
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-∞) for 2mg test was compared with 2 mg reference gum, and 4 mg test was compared with 4 mg reference gum

arm_group.description: A single dose of Nicotine Mint Gum (2 mg) to be chewed.
A single dose of Nicotine Mint Gum (4 mg) to be chewed.
A single dose of reference nicotine gum (2 mg) to be chewed.
A single dose of reference nicotine gum (4 mg) to be chewed.

intervention.description: 2 mg nicotine gum in two formulations
4 mg nicotine gum in two formulations

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI within the range of 19 to 30 kilograms/meters^2
- Current cigarette smokers who have smoked daily for at least a year, and smoke their first cigarette within 30 minutes of waking up
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who have attempted to quit smoking in the last 12 months, are currently attempting to quit smoking or reduce the number of cigarettes they smoke, or are intending to quit smoking in the next 3 months, with or without use of smoking cessation aids
- Treatment with known hepatic enzyme altering agents

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Potential participants were recruited at a single site in the UK.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 160 participants were screened for this study, of which 84 participants were randomized. Seventy seven participants completed the study.

group.title: 2mg Mint Gum/4mg Ref Gum/4mg Mint Gum/2mg Ref Gum
group.description: Participants randomly received 2mg nicotine mint gum or 4mg reference (ref) nicotine gum or 4mg nicotine mint gum or 2mg ref nicotine gum once daily on Day 1 of treatment period 1. After a 2-7 day washout period, participants were returned to the next treatment period until all four treatment periods were completed.

group.title: 4mg Ref Gum/2mg Ref Gum/2mg Mint Gum/4mg Mint Gum
group.description: Participants randomly received 4mg ref nicotine gum or 2mg ref nicotine gum or 2mg nicotine mint gum or 4mg nicotine mint gum once daily on Day 1 of treatment period 1. After a 2-7 day washout period, participants were returned to the next treatment period until all four treatment periods were completed.

group.title: 2mg Ref Gum/4mg Mint Gum/4mg Ref Gum/2mg Mint Gum
group.description: Participants randomly received 2mg ref nicotine gum or 4mg nicotine mint gum or 4mg ref nicotine gum or 2mg nicotine mint gum once daily on Day 1 of treatment period 1. After a 2-7 day washout period, participants were returned to the next treatment period until all four treatment periods were completed.

group.title: 4mg Mint Gum/2mg Mint Gum/2mg Ref Gum/4mg Ref Gum
group.description: Participants randomly received 4mg nicotine mint gum or 2mg nicotine mint gum or 2mg ref nicotine gum or 4mg ref nicotine gum once daily on Day 1 of treatment period 1. After a 2-7 day washout period, participants were returned to the next treatment period until all four treatment periods were completed.

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve From Time 0 to Time 't' [AUC(0-t)] of Nicotine 2 mg Test and Reference Product
outcome.description: AUC(0-t) for 2 mg test was compared with 2 mg reference gum
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples to be collected from baseline to 12 hours post dose
outcome.population: Bioequivalence evaluable subjects' population: participants randomized to 1 of 4 treatment sequences; took atleast one dose of study medication (both test and reference) in 2 mg dose and/or in 4 mg doses; did not have any adverse event assimilated to vomiting in first 4 h post-treatment; and did not have baseline nicotine concentration >5% of Cmax.

group.title: Test Nicotine Gum (2 mg)
group.description: A single dose of Nicotine Mint Gum (2 mg) to be chewed.

group.title: Reference Nicotine Gum (2 mg)
group.description: A single dose of Reference Nicotine Gum (2 mg) to be chewed.

measure.title: Area Under the Curve From Time 0 to Time 't' [AUC(0-t)] of Nicotine 2 mg Test and Reference Product
measure.description: AUC(0-t) for 2 mg test was compared with 2 mg reference gum
measure.population: Bioequivalence evaluable subjects' population: participants randomized to 1 of 4 treatment sequences; took atleast one dose of study medication (both test and reference) in 2 mg dose and/or in 4 mg doses; did not have any adverse event assimilated to vomiting in first 4 h post-treatment; and did not have baseline nicotine concentration >5% of Cmax.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis stated that there was no difference between the test and reference gums in AUC(0-t)
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Bioequivalence was to be established between the test and reference treatment if the 90% CI of ratio of geometric means (Test/Reference) was included within the bioequivalence limits of (0.80, 1.25)

outcome.title: Time to Maximum Observed Concentration (Tmax) of Nicotine 2 mg Test and Reference Products, and Nicotine 4 mg Test and Reference Products
outcome.description: Tmax for 2 mg test was compared with 2 mg reference gum, and 4 mg test was compared with 4 mg reference gum
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples to be collected from baseline to 12 hours post dose
outcome.population: Bioequivalence evaluable subjects' population: participants randomized to 1 of 4 treatment sequences; took atleast one dose of study medication (both test and reference) in 2 mg dose and/or in 4 mg doses; did not have any adverse event assimilated to vomiting in first 4 h post-treatment; and did not have baseline nicotine concentration >5% of Cmax.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
